content:
Diagnosis:	Endometrial cancer - Grade 2 endometrioid adenocarcinoma, stage pT2N0M0

Management:	22 Mar 2024 Total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy
	Adjuvant carboplatin/paclitaxel chemotherapy commenced April 2024

Current Situation:	Seen prior to cycle 4 carboplatin/paclitaxel

I reviewed [redacted name] today who is progressing well through her adjuvant chemotherapy regime. She has managed the first three cycles with minimal side effects, experiencing only grade 1 fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy affecting her fingertips. Her main symptoms have been alterations in taste and occasional nausea, well controlled with regular ondansetron. She maintains good mobility and continues with daily walking.

On examination today, she is well with stable vital signs. Abdominal examination shows well-healed surgical scars with no concerning features. Blood results show stable parameters suitable for proceeding with cycle 4.

The plan is to continue with cycle 4 chemotherapy today. We will see her again in three weeks for pre-cycle 5 assessment. She understands to contact the unit if she develops any concerning symptoms in the interim.

cancer_timeline.value: Total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy
Completed 3 cycles carboplatin/paclitaxel with good tolerance

patient_facts.value: Alterations in taste and occasional nausea, controlled with ondansetron
Well-healed surgical scars, no concerning features on abdominal examination
Blood results stable and suitable for chemotherapy

status_updates.value: Early stage endometrial cancer post-surgery, progressing well through adjuvant chemotherapy with minimal toxicity
Grade 1 fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips
Review in three weeks for pre-cycle 5 assessment
